meaningMnemonic: There's so much <radical>grain</radical> in your <radical>mouth</radical> you need to use a <radical>knife</radical> to remove it. Only when there is a <kanji>surplus</kanji> can you put that much grain in your mouth.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>surplus</kanji> is thanks to the hard work of folks like <reading>Joe</reading> (じょう), the big farmhand. He worked hard to make sure there was a surplus of grain this year.
